item.title: 'Extreme weather' thwarts search for missing girl
item.description: Inaayah, 7, from Blackburn was hit by a large wave as she sat on rocks on a beach in Casablanca. Source: BBC Lancashire

item.title: Racial Justice Sunday events in County include special Cathedral service; services in parish and a new song with Christian Aid
item.description: This weekend Racial Justice Sunday will be marked across the Diocese in many Church of England parishes, alongside a special service taking place at the County’s Anglican Cathedral in Blackburn. Source: LEP Preston

item.title: Plans to turn old Lancashire town centre insurance office into new restaurant revealed
item.description: A new Blackburn town centre restaurant is on the way in a former insurance office. Source: LEP Preston

item.title: Steel mesh ‘lids’ to be installed on Lancashire magistrates’ court docks to stop defendants escaping
item.description: Steel mesh ‘lids’ on two docks at Blackburn Magistrates’ Court to stop defendants escaping and potentially attacking guards or officials have been given the go ahead. Source: LEP Preston

item.title: 'My brother died in a one-punch attack - this is why I've forgiven the lad who did it'
item.description: The brother of a Blackburn man who was killed in a one-punch attack has come face-to-face someone who did the same thing - and made a surprise announcement. Source: LEP Preston

item.title: "I think they would have been better sticking with Ismael'
item.description: The BBC’s 72+ EFL podcast team analyse Blackburn’s decision to sack experienced manager Valerien Ismael in the middle of a relegation fight. Source: BBC Lancashire

item.title: Blackburn must get next appointment 'spot on'
item.description: BBC Radio Lancashire’s Andy Bayes says Blackburn Rovers could face dire consequences if they fail to get their managerial appointment right. Source: BBC Lancashire

item.title: Cathedral hosts knitted World War Two exhibition
item.description: Blackburn Cathedral is hosting The Longest Yarn exhibition, with 80m of knitted panels on display. Source: BBC Lancashire
